column4: The way I have understood LVM is that you bunch a group of discs together to make a larger disc of them. Such that if you have 2 500GB drives and want to have 1 800GB drive and 2 100GB drives, the information is spread across the two drives. But there is no redundancy and no safety in LVM. Lose one disc, lose it all.
Just wish I had had a few more external disks to back up my LVM. I had 3TB of data. All gone after I lost the LVM-config files.
